headline:
Supervisory Intelligence Research Specialist at ICE/HSI
Relocating to DC Metro Area

defaultPosition.description:
â¢	Group Supervisor for the SAC Miami Intelligence Program (SIP).	
â¢	Provides daily guidance, counseling and management to SIP employees by resolving many difficult personnel issues.
â¢	Contributed to the revision of the SIP Miami Concept of Operations, the PWP drafting processes, creation of the Production Plan and drafting of a standard operation procedure for the SAC Miami Human Intelligence Collection program.
â¢	Continues to establish a network of contacts and liaisons with local, state, and federal law enforcement intelligence components.
â¢	Volunteered to support an ASAC Fort Lauderdale investigation requiring the use of self-taught Bank Scan software.
â¢	Performs technical editing (applies Intelligence Community Directives and the ICE style guide) and was delegated publishing authority on behalf of the Chief Intelligence Officer (CIO).
â¢	Contributes significantly to the production of SAC Miamiâs Annual Threat Assessment. 
â¢	Assists the CIO in interviewing and hiring new talent.
â¢	Acts as the Information Systems Security Officer for the SAC Miami SCIF.
â¢	Runs and manages a fully operational SCIF that assists HSI SAC Miami build large scale cases.
defaultPosition.title: Supervisory Intelligence Research Specialist

positions.title: Supervisory Intelligence Research Specialist

positions.description:
â¢	Supervised Investigative Analysts in the northeast region of the U.S.
â¢	Rated performance evaluations, fields questions, provides a first line assistance, monitors progress and training of analysts in the region.
â¢	Assisted Branch Chief with the organization and planning of training and conferences.
â¢	Assisted Branch Chief with the recruitment and hiring of personnel.
â¢	Coordinated work, travel and logistics related to the operational needs.
â¢	Held the responsibility for independently planning, conducting and coordinating extremely complex multi-faceted analytical assignments and/or research projects in support of diverse investigations and far-reaching financial crimes, cybercrimes, counterfeit, and protective intelligence activities.
â¢	Worked both independently and as part of a team on multiple financial cases at a time with limited supervision.
â¢	Used computer aided applications and manual processes to track and analyze investigative cases.
â¢	Created intuitive, icon-based charts to display findings through graphical depiction. 
â¢	Served as the lead analyst for criminal analysis on an investigative team, which requires travel within assigned office district, other regions, Headquarters or overseas.
â¢	Served as a liaison with other law enforcement agencies, financial institutions, credit card companies, etc., concerning criminal and intelligence investigations.
positions.title: Supervisory Investigative Analyst

positions.description:
â¢	Held the responsibility for independently planning, conducting and coordinating extremely complex multi-faceted analytical assignments and/or research projects in support of diverse investigations and far-reaching financial crimes to include AML, cybercrimes, counterfeit, and protective intelligence activities.
â¢	Worked both independently and as part of a team on multiple financial cases at a time with limited supervision.
â¢	Used computer aided applications and manual processes to track and analyze investigative cases.
â¢	Created intuitive, icon-based charts to display findings through graphical depiction. 
â¢	Served as the lead analyst for criminal analysis on an investigative team, which requires travel within assigned office district, other regions, Headquarters or overseas.
â¢	Served as a liaison with other law enforcement agencies, financial institutions, credit card companies, etc.
â¢	Aided in operating a 24hr Duty Desk in support of worldwide intelligence and criminal investigations. concerning criminal and intelligence investigations.
positions.title: Investigative Analyst
